title: Avoiding pre-existent setting for plugins to be overwritten from a new machine.
content:
Hello everyone, I am experiencing this issue since - I suppose - Firefox Sync existed. My main machine has - like any other machine I own - Firefox always up to date and a set of plugins like No-Script, an ad-blocker, a theme, GUI icon disposition and whatnot. When I install Firefox on a new device or machine and then proceed to sync them, I lost the theme across all my synced devices, ALL of the registered sites I have trained No-Script and the adblocker not to block and my GUI settings. In short every new machine with a fresh install and sync of Firefox will wipe and overwrite to its defaults any synced custom configuration I have. Is there a solution for this?

Thank you.

title: Weird malware affecting FF on Linux
content:
Hi

My GF just rung up, she is running FF 128.0 (64-bit) from Ubuntu snap on Ubuntu Linux 22.04.4 LTS (which I set up for her and use myself)

She complained that whenever she starts up FF she gets a display about "MS Windows Defender" and ringing some allegedly Microsoft number together with a recorded message over and over.

I logged into her machine remotely using the SSH connection I've set up (Fiewalled so only I can do it), killed FF and she tried it again with the same result.

I told her go go onto Chrome for now, which she did without incident. On no account should she ring the number, which is obviously that of a scammer, although they would be confused by a Linux system.

In the meantime I had a look round the files on her machine. I couldn't find anything in particular, but I wasn't very sure where to look.

I tried deleting the contents of .cache/mozilla/firefox/0e35ujgr.default/startupCache and that enabled her to use FF again but I notice it got repopulated, seemingly with stuff relevant to Windows - however I see that exists on my system.

She almost exclusively uses Facebook on the system, I wonder if it is malware from a FB ad?

Has anyone got any idea about what this malware is, where it came from and what files I should remove from her system if it happens again.

title: Seguridad
content: Creo que Firefox podría estar excluyendo sitios web que no debería excluir por motivos de seguridad: muchos de los sitios web del gobierno de España aparecen como bloqueados, y no tiene sentido porque son totalmente seguros, como cabe esperar. Independientemente de cuál es el nivel de seguridad que yo haya podido poner en mi navegador, los sitios del gobierno deberían estar accesibles en todos los niveles de seguridad. Seguro que hay una explicación razonable de por qué ocurre así, pero espero que podáis encontrar una solución. En cuanto pongo en Chrome las urls de este tipo en las que no puedo entrar con firefox, entro sin problema, pero me gustaría poder entrar con Firefox. Os dejo un ejemplo de url a la que no puedo acceder con Firefox: https://www.mdsocialesa2030.gob.es/agenda2030/subvenciones.htm Muchas gracias por todo y un cordial saludo desde Tarragona!

title: eBay Stylesheet not working
content:
On occasion, eBay styling breaks, leaving me with plain unstyled HTML. Photo below for example.

This doesn't happen everytime, and it happens randomly. But once it has happened once there's no good way of fixing it, and I often have to swap browser.

There have been a number of questions about this on support.mozilla, but all are archived. One of the suggested solutions is to disable tracking protection for the site, on the premise that eBay's tracking files are mixed in with their styling files, but disabling tracking protection does not fix the problem.

I'm using FF 128.0 on macOS Sonoma 14.5.

For me, the solution was to disable the disconnect.me browser extension.
creator: debeaumont.louis

title: Can hardly find back to my own post (Connect vs Support)
content:
I recently posted a question in - as I thought - the Mozilla community/support forum. I don't exactly remember the link I went to, but since I am logged in to my browser with a Firefox account, I could opt to log in to that forum with it, I didn't need to type my password, just click the button to use my existing account. So far so good.

I got an answer via e-mail. The email contained no plain link back to the post or answer. It contained a big green button "Mark as solved" and a link "This doesn't solve my problem", graphically positioned as to make it quite analogous to the big green button.

I didn't want to quickly mark the answer as either one, I wanted to go there to reply.

In the answer, however, the person answering me included a link to another post. I hoped that, clicking on this one, would - first of all - be of interest, and - secondly - lead me back to the forum in a neutral way so that I could find my own post there via my profile. Again, I clicked on a button to use Mozilla to login. Now I seem to have a second profile, the two are obviously not the same. Also, the forums don't quite seem to be the same. Support Mozilla vs Connect Mozilla. Why are they handled differently, why didn't I get the option to login with my firefox-account, when Connect Mozilla even gets my email adress automatically from it?

So, I had to try one of the buttons, they have different link addresses. I obviously tried the one that said "This doesn't solve my problem", and it plainly led me back to the answer on the (correct) forum and opened the replyform, also showing a button again: "Solved" and "This doesn't solve my problem". Why isn't the link in the email just labelled as linking you back to the forum, like "View thread" or "Reply to thread".

In addition I did not easily understand how to vote for the suggested idea in the linked post. A community manager had posted the reply that the post is now idea-status and that it is open to "votes (aka kudos)". No link or button to do it. Some scrolling around led my eye to an answer in the post to have one kudo, so I understood it had something to do with the like-button. Scrolled up to the original post, which did not have the word kudo on its like button, just a number. Hovering over it I finally got to know that I could give kudos by pressing this button. I got confused since several answers had this button. It was just a like-button to me, not the special vote-button that only appears if a manager opens the vote. Why is the manager text not just: "Vote (aka 'leave kudos') by clicking the like-button, which is now enabled."
creator: mak2

title: Firefox seemt to have made a huge error by "Firefox 128  sends data per default Data for Advert agencies.

16.7.2024

I read this German article:

Firefox 128 liefert per Default Daten für Werbetreibende

Mozilla lässt eine neue Technologie für "datenschutzfreundliche digitale Werbung" in den Firefox einziehen. Die Aktivierung erfolgt ohne Einwilligung der Nutzer.

Which means Firefox 128 Delivers per-default Data for Advert agencies. Mozilla allows a new technology for "Date protection friendly digit Advertising" on Firefox. The activation is without permission from the user.

This is not good at all. I am now thinking of rejecting Fierfoy and moving to Opera or similar. Why did Morzilla take this fatal step?

title: How to block access to Firefox
content:
Hi. I am asking for help: how to protect with a password (preferably master) any access to the browser (and not only to logins), where there is simultaneous synchronization between several devices. Currently it works like this: I run FF, a popup appears for entering the password. I do not enter the password, I close the popup with "x". And thus I have access to everything that was previously open in the browser (in the previous session). If the user was logged in, I also have access to it. title: Scrolling lags when primary display is disabled (windows 11)
content:
Setup: Laptop with integrated Intel UHD 630, dedicated Nvidia RTX 2060 External Monitor connected via USB-C -> rendered through Nvidia card

Issue: Yesterday i disabled my laptop display in the windows settings as i only need my monitor. This resulted in laggish scrolling behaviour in Firefox. Not always but mostly a delay of ~100-300ms. Scrolling up/down fast doesn't really scroll, it just jumps with said delay. It happens on touchpad or mouse (mx master s3). If i enable the main display (extended) everything is fine.

Checked so far:

  • All input-related add-ons, apps (Logi Options+, xmouse button control, ...) are disabled or off
  • A reset or reinstall of Firefox doesn't help
  • Drivers are up to date
  • Changing the graphics performance preference (accelerated, energy saving) in the windows settings doesn't effect the behaviour
  • Smooth Scrolling is off

Any idea what's the matter?
creator: doppelwhopper

title: Firefox is broken (again) after update
content:
Hello there.

After updating, Firefox, once more, lost all my open tabs and history. Extension icons have become invisible on the toolbar even if i unpin and pin them again. Thanks to the extension "Tab Session Manager", I was able to retrieve the json file of my last session but the crazy part is that pages are not loading anymore! Even if I type google.com in the address bar, it just seems to load forever and nothing happens. I have been using Firefox as my main browser for years but this is the second time it happens in about 1 month and I am about to ditch Firefox for good if I can't fix this. Can't afford to lose data like that... Last time it took me a hell of a long time to fix it. This time, pages aren't even loading, except it seems, for the support pages...

Installed extensions: Tab Session Manager, UBlock Origin, Privacy badger, Phantom, Metamask (lost all the wallets data and setup), NordVPN, other crypto wallets...
creator: stephane.cotineau

title: No puedo arrastrar archivos desde el explorador de archivos a las páginas en Firefox.
content:
Hace algunas actualizaciones pasadas [pensé que se solucionaría con alguna otra actualización] se presentó un problema que me impide soltar archivos arrastrados desde el explorador de archivos [Dolphin] a alguna página en firefox. Lo podía solucionar con algunos trucos, como arrastrar hasta la ventana de Firefox, luego a otra ventana cualquiera, volver a Firefox y finalmente soltar el archivo, también había hecho el experimento de soltar el archivo en la barra de direcciones, "lo que en versiones anteriores" solo presentaba el archivo como una página y en la barra de direcciones la dirección [directorio] del archivo de origen mas el nombre de archivo, pero esta vez presentaba un código extraño en la barra de direcciones, y con un mensaje de que Firefox era incapaz de mostrar la página o no era posible interpretar el archivo o dirección. El caso es que con la última actualización, ya no puedo arrastrar ningún archivo de ninguna manera, la página a donde lo quiero llevar se comporta como si fuera a recibir el archivo, pero a la hora de soltarlo, no pasa nada, acabo de intentar soltar el archivo en la barra de direcciones [para copiar aquí el código extraño], pero el cursor cambia a un símbolo de bloqueado, [circulo con una barra cruzada todo en rojo] y al soltarlo no sucede nada. He probado con otros navegadores, Yandex, Opera, y no se presenta ese problema, incluso arrastrar archivos a otros programas, como SMPlayer, Kdenlive incluso documentos a LibreOffice Writer y todo funciona con normalidad, excepto en Firefox.

He eliminado todos los complementos y extensiones, he borrado los archivos temporales y todos los datos de configuración y caché de Firefox, en carpetas ocultas en "home". y el problema persiste, también he usado Firefox sin iniciar sesión, "totalmente limpio" y no desaparece el problema. Como última medida, también he borrado todos los datos de Dolphin... en vano.

He buscado por internet pero aparentemente soy la única persona con este problema, también, en su momento, he buscado el código extraño del que les hablaba pero sin éxito.
